excerpt: This shopping street running alongside a landscaped canal is known for its high-end boutiques.
detail_description: Königсаллее,也被当地人称为“Ko”，是一条繁忙的购物街，沿着一条如画的运河延伸。这个著名的目的地两旁是高档精品店和优雅的设计师商店，是奢华购物的完美场所。
name: Königsallee

excerpt: Lush green space with meadows & formal flowerbeds, plus a pond, bandstand & Henry Moore sculpture.
detail_description: Hofgarten is a serene and picturesque green space located in the heart of the city. As Germany's first and oldest park, it offers nearly 70 acres of lush meadows, ancient trees, ponds, fountains, and beautiful walking paths along the Dussel canal.
name: Hofgarten

detail_description: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V. is a must-visit destination for architecture enthusiasts and culture lovers. Once a rundown commercial port, it has been revitalized into a vibrant hub for media, fashion, and creative industries. The area showcases an intriguing blend of old warehouses alongside modern architectural marvels by renowned architects like Frank Gehry and David Chipperfield.
name: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V.
address: c/o TIGGES Rechtsanwälte, Zollhof 8, 40219 Düsseldorf, Germany

excerpt: Old-town stretch of bars, dance clubs & eateries with an emphasis on local Altbier & world cuisines.
detail_description: Altstadt, also known as the Old Town, is a vibrant stretch of bars, dance clubs, and eateries in Dusseldorf. This area is famous for its local Altbier and diverse world cuisines. With around 300 establishments packed into one compact quarter, Altstadt has earned the moniker of the 'longest bar in the world.'
name: Altstadt

excerpt: Striking 1700s residence with original interiors, a lake & ornate gardens, plus a museum & events.
detail_description: Schloss Benrath, also known as Benrath Palace, is a stunning 18th-century pink palace showcasing the Baroque architectural style. The palace features original interiors and is surrounded by ornate gardens and a picturesque lake. Visitors can explore two museums within the palace: the Museum of European Garden Art and the Museum of Natural History, which house an impressive collection of sculptures, artwork, paintings, and artifacts from the 18th century.
name: Schloss Benrath

excerpt: Large art museum for modern & fine art masterpieces, including works by Rubens & decorative arts.
detail_description: Incorporé
name: Museum Kunstpalast

excerpt: Modern/contemporary art displays, part of the regional state art collection, including Klee & Dalí.
detail_description: KUNSTSAMMLUNG_NORDRHIWN_WFALN_IS_A_MUST_VISIT_FOR_ART_&_HUSIASTS_SHOWCASING_AN_IMPOSSING_COLLCION_OF_MODRN_&_CONTMPORARY_ARTWORKS_COMPRISING_THIR_HOU_S_K_&_F_&_THIS_MUSUM_OFFRS_A_PRMNT_XHIBITION_OF_SIGNIFICANT_UROPN_ART_FROM_TH_&_C_C
name: Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen

excerpt: An observation deck & revolving restaurant on top of a soaring futuristic tower, with city views.
detail_description: The Rhine Tower, also known as Rheinturm, is a must-visit attraction in Dusseldorf. This futuristic tower features an observation deck and a revolving restaurant offering stunning city views. Situated on the banks of the Rhine River near Media Harbor, it provides a unique dining experience with a 360-degree panorama of the city skyline from nearly 170 meters above ground. Designed by architect H.
name: Rhine Tower

excerpt: Catholic church on a site with documents relating to a church on this site dating back to 1159.
detail_description: St. Lambertus Basilika is a Catholic church with a rich history dating back to 1159. It is known for its unique architectural design, particularly its twisted steeple, which has an intriguing legend surrounding its construction. The interior boasts a remarkable collection of modern stained glass windows in light colors. This basilica is celebrated as an architectural gem and holds centuries of music and art within its walls, making it a must-visit attraction in the area.
name: Basilika St. Lambertus

excerpt: Human evolution displays on a significant neanderthal site with a Stone Age workshop & audio guides.
detail_description: The Neanderthal Museum, situated on the outskirts of Dusseldorf, offers an engaging journey through four million years of human evolution. Visitors can explore lifelike human sculptures and interactive audiovisual presentations that vividly depict the story of humankind from its origins to the present day. The museum is located in the Neandertal valley, where the first Neanderthal was discovered over 160 years ago.
name: Neanderthal Museum

detail_description: Dusseldorf's Rhine Embankment Promenade is a delightful spot to unwind and take in the city's scenic views. Opened in 1997, it offers a pleasant walk with vistas of the Rhine River, bridges, and passing boats. Visitors can also relax at nearby restaurants and bars or cycle along the river. The promenade provides a comfortable place to stroll while enjoying both the river view and the old city.
name: Rhine embankment promenade

excerpt: Popular, expansive park featuring themed gardens, fountains, shade trees & walking paths.
detail_description: Nord Park is a well-known and expansive park in Dusseldorf, featuring themed gardens, fountains, shade trees, and walking paths. It was originally planned for the Reich Exhibition Schaffendes Volk in 1936 and opened in 1937. The park offers broad walkways, biking lanes, waterways, playgrounds, and a famous Japanese Garden.
name: Nord Park

excerpt: Düsseldorf is a city in western Germany known for its fashion industry and art scene. It's divided by the Rhine River, with its Altstadt (Old Town) on the east bank and modern commercial areas to the west. In the Altstadt, St. Lambertus Church and Schlossturm (Castle Tower) both date to the 13th century. Streets such as Königsallee and Schadowstrasse are lined with boutique shops.
detail_description: Düsseldorf, located in western Germany, is renowned for its fashion industry and vibrant art scene. The city is divided by the Rhine River, with the historic Altstadt situated on the east bank and modern commercial areas on the west. Visitors can explore landmarks such as St. Lambertus Church and Schlossturm (Castle Tower), both dating back to the 13th century, while strolling along charming streets like Königsallee and Schadowstrasse lined with stylish boutique shops.
name: Düsseldorf

excerpt: City's oldest district & a riverside suburb with Baroque houses, cobblestone streets & castle ruins.
detail_description: Düsseldorf-Kaiserswerth is the city's oldest district and a charming riverside suburb located just a 40-minute tram ride north from the Altstadt. This historic German village features cobblestone streets, Baroque houses, and castle ruins, creating a picturesque setting. The leafy main platz is surrounded by cafes and beer gardens, while the Kaiserswerth Market avenue offers chic boutiques and cozy restaurants.
name: Düsseldorf-Kaiserswerth

excerpt: Events venue in a converted warehouse housing classic cars, shops & a restaurant with a beer garden.
detail_description: Classic Remise Düsseldorf is a unique venue located in a converted warehouse in Dusseldorf, Germany. It serves as a hub for classic car enthusiasts, offering a variety of attractions such as classic car showrooms, repair and restoration facilities, parts shops, auto storage spaces, and stores selling auto-related clothing and gifts. The venue also features glass storage 'boxes' where owners can securely store their cars while still making them visible to visitors.
name: Classic Remise Düsseldorf

detail_description: Rheinuferpromenade, located on the right bank of the Rhine in Dusseldorf, is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. The promenade offers a picturesque walkway that stretches from the Parliament down to the harbor, providing ample sunshine throughout the day. Since 1993, when road traffic was redirected underground, visitors have been able to enjoy a peaceful stroll along the river.
name: Rheinuferpromenade

excerpt: Upscale shops & restaurants featured in a sleek facility with striking, ultramodern architecture.
detail_description: Kö-Bogen is a modern architectural marvel located in Dusseldorf, Germany. Designed by Daniel Liebeskind, this sleek facility features upscale shops and restaurants within its striking, ultramodern glass and white stone structure. The building stands out with its innovative design and urban functionality, offering green rooftop terraces and vibrant public spaces that showcase contemporary urban living and sustainability.
name: Kö-Bogen

excerpt: Changing art exhibitions with a focus on photography and new media in a minimalist gallery.
detail_description: Located in the Ehrenhof complex near the Rhine and Düsseldorf's renowned art academy, NRW-Forum Düsseldorf is a minimalist gallery that showcases changing art exhibitions with a focus on photography, architecture, fashion, design, and digital culture. The museum is part of the Museum Kunstpalast and offers a diverse program including symposia, workshops, and film screenings. Past exhibitions have featured works by artists like Liu Xiaodong and explored the intersection of AI and art.
name: NRW-Forum Düsseldorf

excerpt: Modern art collection & temporary exhibits in a state-of-the-art update of a 19th-century building.
detail_description: The Kunstsammlung is a modern art collection housed in a renovated 19th-century building. The Standehaus am Kaiserteich, formerly the seat of the Parliament of North Rhine-Westphalia, was transformed into a contemporary art space in 2002. The museum features four wings with continuous arcades surrounding a spacious plaza and boasts a striking glazed domed roof that shapes the building's aesthetic.
name: Kunstsammlung

excerpt: This museum offers themed rooms depicting the evolution of biodiversity, with a range of animals.
detail_description: Aquazoo Löbbecke Museum in Dusseldorf is a fascinating museum that showcases the evolution of biodiversity through themed rooms filled with a variety of animals. It's a great choice for both younger and older kids, offering aquariums, exhibits, and even the opportunity to book a children's birthday tour where they can interact with animals like frogs and toads. The museum also offers convenient parking and reasonable entrance fees.
name: Aquazoo Löbbecke Museum Dusseldorf

excerpt: Tranquil gardens designed by landscape architect Iwakii Ishiguro with fish ponds & water features.
detail_description: The Japanese Garden in Nordpark, Dusseldorf is a serene and tranquil oasis designed by landscape architect Iwakii Ishiguro. Spanning 36.6 hectares, the park features wide pathways ideal for walking and biking, vibrant flower beds, shaded ponds, fountains, and themed gardens. The Japanese Garden offers a slice of traditional Japan with its maples, black pines, gravel-bordered ponds, sculptures, and traditional seating.
name: Japanese Garden

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Düsseldorf, Schloss Jägerhof is a stunning Baroque-style palace that adds charm to the picturesque Hofgarten, one of the city's most beautiful gardens. This elegant structure, with its distinctive tower and two wings, dates back to the mid-18th century and has served various roles throughout history, including a military hospital. Today, it proudly houses the Goethe Museum, which features an extensive collection dedicated to the life and works of renowned literary figure Johann Wolfgang von Goethe.
name: Schloss Jägerhof

detail_description: Little Tokyo Düsseldorf, located between the main train station and Konigsallee, is a bustling district known for its authentic Japanese culinary offerings. Visitors can indulge in delicious ramen, sushi, and kaiseki at some of the most genuine Japanese restaurants in Germany. In addition to dining options, the area also features Asian supermarkets, manga stores, karaoke bars, bubble tea shops, and Korean bakeries.
name: Little Tokyo Düsseldorf

excerpt: Busy Carlstadt centers on the open-air Market on Carlsplatz, where stalls offer regional cheese and wurst specialties, plus street snacks like crepes, sausages and Italian and Indian eats. Cobbled streets are lined with upscale boutiques, jewelers and galleries. The K21 museum and the underground Kunst im Tunnel (KIT) host rotating art shows, while the Stadtmuseum’s city history exhibits span ancient to modern eras.
detail_description: Düsseldorf-Carlstadt is a bustling area known for its open-air market, Carlsplatz, which offers a variety of regional specialties and street food. The cobblestone streets are filled with upscale boutiques, jewelers, and galleries. Visitors can explore art at the K21 museum and Kunst im Tunnel (KIT), as well as delve into the city's history at the Stadtmuseum.
name: Düsseldorf-Carlstadt

detail_description: Schauspielhaus in Dusseldorf is renowned as the city's premier theater, offering a diverse range of performances including concerts and readings. The venue consistently draws large crowds due to its exceptional acoustics, skilled performers, and impressive costumes, resulting in highly praised shows.
name: Schauspielhaus

detail_description: Burgplatz is a lively spot in Dusseldorf, especially from May to September. It attracts both locals and tourists who gather on the steps next to the Rhine river, indulge in food and wine festivals, have barbecues in Rheinpark, enjoy drinks in the Altstadt, and watch the sunset from Paradiesstrand. The summer season offers long days with ample opportunities for exploration or simply soaking up the sunny weather.
name: Burgplatz

excerpt: Free park featuring native animals in natural looking enclosures, plus a bee house & playground.
detail_description: Nestled in Dusseldorf, Wildpark Düsseldorf Grafenberg is a sprawling wildlife park spanning over 62 hectares of lush woodlands. The park boasts natural-looking enclosures where visitors can marvel at native animals such as deer, wild boar, raccoons, and raptors. Children can enjoy the large play area and forest school while exploring the picturesque walking routes and peaceful ponds.
name: Wildpark Düsseldorf Grafenberg

excerpt: Bronze relief sculpture commemorating Dusseldorf receiving city rights in the 13th century.
detail_description: Incorporé,
name: Stadterhebungsmonument

excerpt: Set below the Rhine Promenade, this exhibition space features rotating shows of contemporary art.
detail_description: Located beneath the Rhine Promenade, Kunst im Tunnel (KIT) is an exhibition space that showcases rotating contemporary art shows. Since its opening in 2007, KIT has become a hub for experimental art from emerging artists. The unique elliptical arc of nearly 140 meters runs parallel to the Rhine, giving the space a distinctive architectural appeal. Exhibitions at KIT span various mediums including video, installation, sculpture, and painting.
name: Kunst im Tunnel

excerpt: Historic landmark building & old Town Hall with a stately facade, constructed between 1570 & 1573.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Düsseldorf's Altstadt, the Town Hall is a historic gem that dates back to 1570-1573. With its impressive facade, it stands as a testament to the city's rich architectural heritage. Surrounded by charming old buildings and churches, including the iconic St. Lambertus Church and Castle Tower, this landmark offers visitors a glimpse into the past.
name: Town Hall

excerpt: Traditional Japanese temple, cultural center & gardens offering tours, events & Buddhist ceremonies.
detail_description: EKŌ-Haus der Japanischen Kultur e.V. is a cultural center and temple that offers an immersive experience into Japanese culture. The center features traditional Japanese architecture, serene gardens with charming bridges, and a Shin-Buddhist temple - one of the few in Europe. Visitors can enjoy guided tours, attend special events and ceremonies, or simply explore the beautiful Japanese garden.
name: EKŌ-Haus der Japanischen Kultur e.V.

excerpt: Converted planetarium, built in 1926, now staging orchestral performances, festivals & other events.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Düsseldorf, the Tonhalle Düsseldorf is a remarkable concert hall that has transformed from a planetarium into a cultural gem since its establishment in 1926. Renowned for its exceptional acoustics and striking architecture, this venue captivates both music lovers and architecture enthusiasts alike with its unique cylindrical design and transparent façade. The Tonhalle hosts an array of orchestral performances, festivals, and events that celebrate both classical and contemporary music, ensuring unforgettable experiences for all attendees.
name: Tonhalle Düsseldorf

excerpt: Stadtmitte is an upscale shopping hub, with high-end flagship stores, boutiques and jewelers clustered around Königsallee or “Kö,” a leafy boulevard framing the Stadtgraben canal. Prestigious cultural venues around sprawling Hofgarten park include the opera house Deutsche Oper am Rhein and the Goethe-Museum. Restaurants range from exclusive fine dining establishments to laid-back Japanese ramen and Korean bbq spots.
detail_description: Düsseldorf-Stadtmitte is a sophisticated district known for its luxurious shopping scene, featuring an array of high-end flagship stores, boutiques, and jewelers concentrated around the elegant Königsallee or “Kö,” which runs alongside the picturesque Stadtgraben canal. This area also boasts prestigious cultural attractions near the expansive Hofgarten park, such as the Deutsche Oper am Rhein opera house and the Goethe-Museum.
name: Düsseldorf-Stadtmitte

excerpt: Relaxed post-war cobblestone square & community gathering place on the Rhine River.
detail_description: Burgplatz is a charming cobblestone square located on the banks of the Rhine River, just west of the Old Town. It was once home to a mighty fortress belonging to the counts of Berg and is now recognized as one of Germany's most beautiful post-war sites. Visitors can admire the remains of old military defense towers and explore the Marine Museum.
name: Burgplatz

excerpt: Sprawling Bilk has a hip, alternative vibe, with low-key Turkish, Thai and Japanese eateries, and vintage clothes and record shops that draw a budget-conscious student crowd. The nightlife scene revolves around unassuming bars pouring local brews, and Boui Boui Bilk, a converted factory hosting music, dance parties and a nighttime flea market. The Botanical Garden has a domed glasshouse with exotic plants.
detail_description: Bilk is a vibrant and trendy neighborhood with a diverse culinary scene featuring Turkish, Thai, and Japanese eateries. It also boasts vintage shops, record stores, and budget-friendly options that attract students. The nightlife in Bilk revolves around casual bars serving local brews and Boui Boui Bilk, a converted factory hosting music events and nighttime flea markets. Additionally, visitors can explore the Botanical Garden with its exotic plants housed in a domed glasshouse.
name: Bilk

excerpt: Thick walls enclose medieval Zons town on the Lower Rhine's west bank, where charming houses sit alongside outdoor cafes, homey restaurants, and ice cream shops on cobblestone streets. The restored Friedestrom Castle complex contains a museum and an outdoor theatre, while the Juddeturm tower features a windmill and a baroque dome. Jugglers and minstrel musicians perform during the annual Matthäusmarkt craft market.
detail_description: Zons is a picturesque medieval town located on the west bank of the Lower Rhine. The town is characterized by its thick walls and cobblestone streets lined with charming houses, outdoor cafes, restaurants, and ice cream shops. Visitors can explore the restored Friedestrom Castle complex housing a museum and an outdoor theatre, as well as the Juddeturm tower featuring a windmill and baroque dome.
name: Zons

detail_description: Stadttor is a skyscraper with futuristic architecture that is definitely worth a visit. Its double-facade structure, based on the principle of double glazing, not only gives it a unique look but also enables natural ventilation, significantly reducing energy consumption.
name: Stadttor

excerpt: Riverside city park with sprawling lawns, playgrounds, jogging paths & an eatery.
detail_description: Rheinpark Golzheim, also known as the Rheinpark, is a picturesque city park located along the banks of the Rhine River in Dusseldorf. Spanning 24 hectares, this expansive park offers stunning views of the Rheinknie, Oberkassel, and Theodor-Heuss bridges. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the 2.5-kilometer riverside promenade or relax on the vast green lawns while taking in panoramic river vistas.
name: Rheinpark Golzheim

detail_description: The Schlossturm, also known as the Castle Tower, is a prominent landmark in Burgplatz, Old Town Dusseldorf. It is the sole surviving part of the City Palace and now houses the SchiffahrtsMuseum, a renowned maritime museum showcasing Germany's rich marine history. The area around Schlossturm comes alive during festivals like Oktoberfest and Carnival, as well as Christmas markets.
name: Schlossturm

detail_description: Flingern Nord, known for its motto "Enjoyment without regret," is home to Cafe Huftgold, where visitors can indulge in a selection of eight to 10 homemade cakes daily. The cafe offers the option of adding an extra portion of rich cream for those in need of a sugar rush.
name: Flingern Nord

detail_description: Promenade in Dusseldorf is a must-visit spot offering a beautiful view of the river Rhein. It's the perfect place to embark on a ship tour and enjoy the stunning scenery. The Burgplatz provides an excellent vantage point over the Oberkassel area and easy access to the boats below. Whether you're alone, with your partner, or in a larger group, this location offers a vacation-like ambiance where you can savor coffee or cocktails while taking in the picturesque surroundings.
name: Promenade

detail_description: In Dusseldorf, the K21 Kunstsammlung hosts the captivating 'In Orbit' art installation, suspended over 25 meters above ground. This multi-layered steel mesh structure allows visitors to explore different levels while looking down at the bustling activity below. Another intriguing street art project in Dusseldorf is 'Saulenheilige,' where characters are depicted standing on pillars, playing with the double meaning of its German name.
name: Street Art

detail_description: Ackerstraße is located in the gentrified northern borough of Flingern, known for its leafy squares and independent cafes. The street is lined with vintage boutiques, upcycling shops, artists' ateliers, and galleries. Visitors can enjoy a mix of experiences, from picking up couture hats to getting tattoos. The area also boasts pleasant eateries like Bulle Bistro and Cafe Huftgold, which is famous for its fabulous cakes.
name: Ackerstraße

excerpt: Remains of a 12th-century castle open seasonally, with river & countryside views.
detail_description: Kaiserpfalz Kaiserswerth is a 12th-century castle located in Dusseldorf, with picturesque views of the river and countryside. The palace has a rich history dating back to the 10th century and has witnessed centuries of wars, conquests, and destruction. Although mostly in ruins today, the castle still exudes romance and charm. Visitors can explore its thick walls, staircases, and ancient windows while enjoying views of the river.
name: Kaiserpfalz Kaiserswerth

detail_description: Located in Dusseldorf, Alter Bahnhof Oberkassel is a popular pub with a wide selection of regional beers, including their house beer Gulasch Altbier. The interior resembles a traditional German beer hall and features large brewing vats on-site. One unique feature is the big copper pipes that pump fresh beer around the building. This brewery is part of an area with six microbreweries, where visitors can enjoy fresh beer and rustic regional cuisine.
name: Alter Bahnhof Oberkassel

excerpt: Elegant shopping center featuring 60 stores, international restaurants & a nursing/changing lounge.
detail_description: Schadow-Arkaden is a stylish shopping center in Dusseldorf, playing a crucial role in connecting the city's downtown area. With around 60 stores offering global clothing brands and home items, it also features an international food court. Adjacent to Stilwerk mall and Saks of 5th department store, Schadow-Arkaden is a haven for designer outlets.
name: Schadow-Arkaden

excerpt: Founded in 1909, this museum with a gift shop & a library showcases ceramics from around the world.
detail_description: The Hetjens Museum, established in 1909, is a remarkable institution that offers a unique journey through the history of ceramics. With over 20,000 pieces dating back to 6000 B.C., the museum's exhibitions are organized by geographical origin, showcasing the evolution and design of ceramics from regions such as Europe, East Asia, and Islam.
name: Hetjens-Museum

excerpt: Interactive cinematic museum with rare technical items, movie posters, film archives & a cinema.
detail_description: The Filmmuseum Düsseldorf, located in the heart of the city's Old Town, offers a captivating journey through the world of cinema. Spanning 2,000 square meters across four floors, this interactive museum showcases an array of rare technical items, movie posters, film archives, and even features its own cinema called the Black Box. Visitors can explore an extensive collection that includes props, costumes, decorations, cameras and set models while delving into the rich history of filmmaking.
name: Filmmuseum Düsseldorf

excerpt: Grand 18th-century house with a collection of artifacts relating to Goethe's life & work.
detail_description: The Goethe-Museum Düsseldorf is located within the impressive Schloss Jagerhof, a grand 18th-century house that offers a fascinating collection of artifacts related to the life and work of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe. The museum showcases manuscripts, letters, books, and busts of Goethe, providing visitors with an intriguing insight into his life.
name: Goethe-Museum Düsseldorf

excerpt: Contemporary German & European art in 1970s museum with tunnel gallery displaying new artists' work.
detail_description: Kunsthalle Düsseldorf is a must-visit for art and culture enthusiasts, offering a diverse array of masterpieces that will leave you in awe. Located in the heart of Dusseldorf's Old Town, this museum features dynamic changing exhibitions, making it an ideal destination to embrace attractive artworks and discover new artists' work. With no permanent collection, the museum remains open to various artistic styles through its constantly rotating displays.
name: Kunsthalle Düsseldorf
